result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek W Amoroso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time if revoked.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Enroll within 60 days.

Must complete any programming or treatment required by agent.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation if necessary. Not subject to good time.

CASES: 22CM30 & 22CM149. 8:38 AM Defendant Derek W Amoroso in court.  Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Derek W Amoroso.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. ADA indicates an amended complaint has been filed. ADA recites agreement. On 22CM30 amended count 2- def- G plea. CT accepts, adj G. Count 1 and 22CM149 RI&D on state's motion. 

SENTENCE:  Imp/stayed 90 days jail. 30 days banked jail for probation. Banked jail is not subj to good time. AODA and comply. Any programming or treatment required by agent. $265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surcharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. 1 year probation. Imp jail is subject to good time if revoked. PCR. 8:52 am adj.

3:35 PM Defendant Derek W Amoroso in court. Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Derek W Amoroso. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. ADA Wood Webster calls officer Mariakis- S&T. Atty Sanders cross. ADA- argument. Atty Sanders- argument. CT makes findings. CT denies def's motion to suppress. Trial is set for next week. Settlement deadline extended to Friday 10/14 by 4:00 pm. Bond cont. 3:59 pm adj.
